Description:
Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

Author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g (rule), oscd.community (improvements)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (((process_path like '%\powershell.exe' or process_path like '%\pwsh.exe') and (original_file_name = 'powershell.exe' or original_file_name = 'pwsh.dll')) and  not ((parent_process_path like '%:\windows\explorer.exe' or parent_process_path like '%:\windows\system32\compattelrunner.exe' or parent_process_path like '%:\windows\syswow64\explorer.exe') or parent_process_path = ':\$windows.~bt\sources\setuphost.exe') and  not ((parent_process_path like '%:\program files\windowsapps\microsoft.windowsterminal_%' and parent_process_path like '%\windowsterminal.exe') or (parent_process_path like '%\appdata\local\programs\microsoft vs code\code.exe' and parent_command_line like '% --ms-enable-electron-run-as-node %')))
